name: Dinner Tonight: Broiled Eggplant Japonaise
description: This week's score at the farmers' market were a bunch of tiny little eggplants—all about the size of a small pickle. The proprietor said he preferred the taste of these smaller specimens, and that I would, too. Though they weren’t...

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the broiler. Slice the eggplants into 1/2 inch strips. Cover a baking sheet with aluminum foil and pour 2 tablespoons of the oil on top. Mix the eggplant with the oil and sprinkle with salt. Place in the broiler. Cook for 4-5 minutes per side, or until eggplant is nice and soft.
Mix together the minced garlic, soy sauce, sugar, and tabasco sauce.
Toss the eggplant in a large bowl, and dose with the sauce. It tastes good warm, but also surprisingly well at room temperature.
